name: Fairfield Inn Orlando Lake Buena Vista in the Marriott Village

reviews.title: Perfect price performance
reviews.text: Everything was just what I hoped for. Clean, new, comfortable. The breakfast was also great.
I would definitely come back.
reviews.title: Loved Fairfield Inn
Great hotel and superb beds
reviews.text: We just returned from a stay at the Fairfield Inn Marriott Village. I was nervous about the hotel - after reading a wide range of reviews and opinions. We were very pleasantly surprised. The grounds are maintained very well and are very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful - all the staff. The rooms are a typical hotel room size- BUT VERY CLEAN!!!! We enjoyed the outdoor pool and did spend time at one of the other Hotels in the Village pool - this was also a nice option. The hotel was quiet at night. We ate the breakfast every morning. The weekend days the Breakfast Dining Area was busy - and we had to wait for a waffel maker - but this was to be expected. Overall I would recommend this and return to this Hotel.

reviews.title: Superb location and excellent value for money
reviews.text: It´s a great location, clean, excepcional beds, and great staff. No doubt, the next time I repeat in this hotel.

reviews.title: Not so comfortable, but an okay hotel.
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel from end of Jan to beginning of Feb. Having stayed at 5*'s in WDW we were pleasantly suprised on entering the resort. As previously mentioned the grounds and the exterior give you the feel that you are staying at a top class hotel.

reviews.title: Great Location, good rooms and service
reviews.text: Great Location, good rooms and good service.
breakfast is ok too.
reviews.title: Great place, very close to Disney

reviews.text: We had considered staying here for the "main" part of the vacation, but ended up choosing the Downtown Disney Hilton instead. But we needed a place to stay the first couple nights for "cheap", and I was going to just go with a Super 8 or what not, but decided to roll the dice with Priceline (something I'd never done before) and much to my delight I was placed here for $45/night. So my perception of value is a little tainted since I paid nearly 1/3 the rack rate. But we were very pleased with this place.
reviews.title: Best hotel not in Disney!!!!

reviews.text: The location is great - It's about a mile or so from Downtown Disney. The property is shared with the two neighboring Marriot properties, so you have 3 pools to choose from, etc. The rooms contained a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, and other niceties. High Speed Wi-fi was included, although it a bit more like "low-speed" at times. Free parking was available, something that the Hilton charged us $10/night for. The free breakfast was excellent as well.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: We did not use their provided transportation to Disney, so I cannot comment on that. So I can only recommend this if you have a car. If you don't, you might want to check some of the other reviews from those who used the available bus service. But if you have a car, we most definitely recommend this place.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay. No complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for the first two weeks of September 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel makes up 1 of 3 in a small village like complex. Theres a loveley pool which we didnt go to bu it looked really nice, shops eg pizza hut Krispy Kremes, Starbucks, a small travel agent Meres Travelwhere you can book tickets for the theme parks and also book the courtesy coaches to the parks. You can use all the facilities of the other 2 hotels aswell.
reviews.title: Fab!!!

likes.disliked: — If i have to be picky the breakfast choice

reviews.text: The rooms are really niceley furnihsed and very modern. Ours came with 2 kings beds, a huge TV, bath, shower, coffee machine, great view of the pool, free little shampoos, soaps, hairdryer. Cleans towles everyday. What more could you ask for. We stayed at the Best Western Movieland 2 years ago and this hotel is much better. You can hear the air conditioning unit from outside but really its not that much of a problem so dont worry.
reviews.title: Great Again!

likes.liked: — It was clean and alot of things to do in the area.
likes.disliked: — The front desk person left at 11pm and you had to go next door or use phone if you had problem.

reviews.text: Breakfast was provided every morning but didnt have a great deal of choice (cereals, bagels, toast, fruit, waffel maker - this gets very busy. Would have been nice if some hot breakfasts were provided but suppose i shouldnt winge for the price I paid.
reviews.title: Excellent All Round

likes.disliked: — Continental breakfast was busy at times but manageable

reviews.text: The hotel is also next door to the wonderful Bahama Breeze and Golden Corral restaurantes. Bahama Breeze is a must. The cocktails are fab!!. They even give free ones!!.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Good Position for Parks, Good Stay

reviews.text: Location wise its not to bad either. We hired a car but Its located about ten mins walk from the premium outlets where you can get the I Ride Trolley from to Universal and about a 45 min walk (2 milesish) to Downtown Disney. So all in all its not bad.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Arrived at the Fairfield 4th Sept 2010 to be informed it was fully booked, which was a shock as we had booked our room 6 months earlier, and just not what you want to hear after a 12 hour journey.
reviews.title: Overbooked

reviews.text: Was advised we would be upgraded to the Marriott, which is part of this 3 hotel complex, great! NO not really put on 4th floor which needed refurb and in room next to cleaners store room which meant we were awoken 8am every morning, yes some days we were already up but some days we did want to rest longer.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, ideal location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not upgraded to having breakfast in Marriott but had to go to Fairfield, the breakfast was chaotic and no matter what time we went we struggled to get somewhere to get a seat and table.
reviews.title: great stay for one night

reviews.text: It also appears to be attracting large groups of teenagers arriving for Soccer tournaments so if you are after quiet forget it.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 5th time we have stayed here, all previous times were good, not this time, the management need to make the breakfast area larger and not overbook, this is poor practice.
reviews.title: Good value hotel in a convenient location.

reviews.text: We stayed here in Nov 2005 for 2 weeks and had a great stay.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Staff were great and went out of their way to cater for any requests.
reviews.title: pleasant surprise!
Great Location and relly good value
reviews.text: Free Breakfast was more than adequate

reviews.title: great deal in orlando
reviews.text: Room cleaned every single day and has all you need
Location absolutely superb for theme parks
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location

reviews.text: This hotel is typical of a Fairfield Inn (nothing fancy, but comfortable). It is in a great location if you are wanting to visit several of the different theme parks. You are located about half way between Disney and Universal Parks, and Sea World is just up the road.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable, Centrally Located
this hotel should have a 4 star rating, not 2 - very clean
reviews.text: Our room had 2 beds (I think queen), a small sitting area, a desk, refrigerator, sink, and microwave. There were 2 televisions - one in the bedroom area and one in the sitting area. You cannot watch both at the same time as they are too close together and there is no door separating the bedroom area from the sitting room. The sitting area had a sofa and a chair. I believe the sofa would pull out into a bed. The bathroom was clean and roomy. It had a vanity with one sink outside the rest of the bathroom area.

reviews.title: A nice stay at Fairfield Inn
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surpised by breakfast. They had a lot larger selection than I was expecting. The buffet had fruit, bagels, muffins, doughnuts, 3 different cereals, bread, hot oatmeal and toppings, yogurt, jams, cream cheese, coffe, tea, hot chocolate, milk, orange juice, apple juice - pretty much anything you could want. There is a toasting station with several toasters and a waffle making station with 4 waffle irons. The line could get long at the waffle area during the busiest times. They also had a different hot selection each day. One day there were hot biscuits with sausage patties, the other day there was scrambled eggs with sausage patties. Everything I tried tasted very good and fresh. The eggs tasted like real eggs, not powdered. One of the best free breakfast offerings I've seen.
I would stay here again if I needed to be in this area.
reviews.title: Excellent value, good clean hotel, well located

reviews.text: March 25, 2006
reviews.title: Very nice
Great Stay!
reviews.text: Hubby & I stayed for 2 nights at the Fairfield Inn. Check in was quick and easy, and we were allowed to check in early 1pm. Amanda at the front desk was very helpful, friendly and a joy to deal with. Despite our room being close to the elevators, ice machine and the laundry room it was very quiet. All of the staff were very friendly and pleasant. Rooms were clean. Free breakfast was a great way to start the day. Only two issues, the breakfast area needs more than 2 toasters for all the guests. And parking was difficult late at night when we returned from dancing. All in all a great place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coming all the way down from Brazil for my first visit to the Walt Disney World Resorts, I was very pleased to have stayed at this hotel. For US$ 69 a night we enjoyed free parking for our rental car, great breakfast (donuts, warm and cold milk, waffles, yogurts, bagels, bread, orange and cranberry juices, jelly, syrup, etc.), free wireless internet, nice confy beds, decent bathroom and a rather enjoyable swimming pool on the outside, which we surely needed in the boiling Floridian August.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice and cheap!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides, the Marriot Village's got a PIzza Hut and a Starbucks Coffee just beside the hotel, very useful when you want to grab a bite but doesn't want to leave the hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel excellent breakfast and helpful staff

reviews.text: It was a great experience, and I'll be back soon for another 10-day vacation at this very same hotel. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: An excellent hotel for a greta price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stay here for are honeymoon and can say it's a great hotel and good food you can share all the pools in the 3 hotels in the courtyard which also has food and bars and it's bang in the middle of orlando.
reviews.title: What a nice happy hotel and great value too..

reviews.text: Nice value hotel. Room a little small but other than that great place to stay in Orlando!
reviews.title: Good value with great beds!
I WILL RETURN...AMAZING
reviews.text: This hotel is very, very, very excellent. The staff is friendly. The building is huge. The price was cheap but it was worth more then what we paid. I was very concern about the low price but my fears were face when we pulled up on the property...let me say "VERY NICE"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Security at the gate, FREE parking, FREE breakfast. We are going back with the family SOON.
reviews.title: We have come back for another 4 weeks here...says it all!! It's great!

reviews.text: We have just returned from another trip to Florida and, like last time, stayed at the Fairfield Inn, Lake Buena Vista for 4 weeks. This could easily seem like a long time staying in a so-called 'budget' hotel, but this hotel is so good it was an absolute breeze of a stay.
reviews.title: Book it!

reviews.text: The hotel is superbly located just off the I4 motorway at junction 68 (the one for the Premium Outlets). The hotel complex (share with a Courtyard and Springhill Suites) is very welcoming and you immediately feel at ease with your surroundings. We were greeted nicely and checked in with no fuss, with the young man on the desk allowing us to have a room in the area of the hotel that we requested.
reviews.title: fantastic fairfield

reviews.text: This hotel is lacking in customer service. We arrived at the hotel after a long, hot day and Disney. As we were getting ready for bed, a light fixture suddenly fell off the ceiling! Fortunately no one was standing underneath it at the time, but hundreds of pieces of broken glass covered the entire floor. I called the front desk and 30 minutes later someone showed up only to say, "Oh Wow!" when I opened the door. We had a 2 year old with us and I was worried she would step on glass. I called the front desk again to request another room and was told they would see what they could do and I hung up after 5 minutes on hold. Finally, a sweet lady from housekkeeping showed up and cleaned the best she could but recommended we go to another room. Duh! She went to the front desk and only then did a manager call to apologize, ask if we were alright, and then sent the housekeeper to help us to another room. The rooms have window heat/air units and it's either freeze with it on or turn it completely off and burn up. No thermostat. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. The beds were soft with nice linens. There is a refrigerator in the room. The breakfast is also nice with plenty of selection.
reviews.title: Beware of falling light fixtures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for several days in May, 2007 during our trip to Orlando. The rooms were very clean, with updated furnishings and bedding and there was a free breakfast buffet included! It was close to theme parks, restaurants, etc. The only downsides to our stay were the noise insulation in the rooms: we could hear people in the hallway quite loudly and the breakfast room was somewhat crowded, but these were minimal problems.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.text: We stayed only a few days, before moving to the Walt Disney World Swan hotel for a conference, but I would say, the service, value and cleanliness were much better at the Fairfield. With a rental car, it was just as convienient to drive to the parks from the Fairfield as it was to use the resort transportation at the Swan; probably even more convienient, because you have more control over it, instead of waiting around for buses, etc. to come! It was definitely better in the food/value department to stay at the Fairfield. At the resorts, you are stuck with the restaurants at the hotel and there is no free breakfast! I found the service at the Fairfield to be friendlier also. I would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: What a wonderful hotel! We were very happy with the location and the ease of getting to all theme parks. Directions from the air[port were right on. When we arrived at 11:00am, not expecting for early check-in, the front desk staff were very, very nice and checked us in immediately! We were very happy with the cleanliness of the room, comfort of the beds, and the separate toilet/sink set-up, that's always nice. Free buffet breakfast was a great plus. Breakfast included is usually not all it's cracked up to be, but, this one was. Hot belgian waffles, assorted muffins, bagels, cereals, breads, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel. Only one downside, we arrived on Thursday May 31st, not knowing that apparently this was some kind of lesbian convention. The Marriott Village was completely taken over by this event! My daughter and myself felt very uncomfortable walking around the village, as many lesbians were drunk, obnoxious, and very affecectionate to each other, shall we say!!!! If we knew this was taking place that weekend we would have made it the following week. Anyways, we didn't let this ruin our vacation, as we spent very little time at the hotel. All in all, I would definetly stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Really good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is among the best. I will definitely stay there again. I was so amazed when I got there. The room is spacious, clean, and very nice. I loved it. There are a number of restaurants nearby, and the hotel offers transportation (for a small fee) to Disney theme Parks. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Not Bad At All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did extensive research while planing our Mid-October vacation to Disney World. I finally determined that the Fairfield Inn was the best
reviews.title: A bit disappointed..

likes.disliked: — They didn't stock the toiletries, the breakfast was useless, the internet worked sporatically

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bang for the buck. They were rated well here, offered free continental
reviews.title: Universal Studios

reviews.text: breakfast and free wifi internet access in room, so it sounded like a winner.
reviews.title: Really good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we had to check-in at the neighboring Courtyard Hotel, which seemed fine at the time but having night staff at only one hotel
reviews.title: Best holiday ever

reviews.text: proved problematic later.
reviews.title: Good value
Clean, Comfortable and a Great Value
reviews.text: This hotel was a good value, comfortable beds, and very clean. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but we weren't there with our children so space wasn't a concern. The location was ideal, close to shopping, attractions and restaurants. The breakfast was good enough but as a recent member indicated, you need to beat the crowd to find a spot to sit (7am).
The place could use an update, new wallpaper and carpet, plus our bathroom had mold on the ceiling. On the positive side, the grounds were well kept and the appearance of the hotel was very nice.
reviews.title: Would Come Again

reviews.text: For the price, this hotel exceeded our expectations, we'll be back!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!
not what I expected
reviews.text: This is the second time I was here. The room was great for Orlando and the internet worked fine. It was not the best Fairfield in the US but I would book it again.
I chose this hotel purely on the reviews I read on your site. I can see why you all rate it so highly!!
reviews.title: Excellent deal

reviews.text: After a long flight from Uk we arrived at the Fairfield Inn early evening to a very friendly welcome from hotel reception staff. The room was immaculate with 2 double beds, mini fridge which was a bonus, air con, hairdryer, coffee facilities.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, brilliant location for Disney Parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A buffet continental breakfast is included which was quite sufficient for our needs. Cereals, donuts, muffins, bagels, yoghurts, fruit, toast, tea/coffee, fruit juices. There is a food court also on site: Starbucks, Pizza Hut, Edys Ice-cream, Sandwich counter, hot food counter. Its quite handy and stays open til 11pm.
reviews.title: Excellent Base to tour Disney

likes.liked: — clean, and friendly and good location

reviews.text: We didnt hire a car and decided to use the shuttles provided at the hotel for the Disney parks. These left at 8,9 &10 in mornings and returned every hour from late afternoon until midnight. During our time these shuttles were very prompt, always leaving on time in the morning and never more than 5 mins late on return journey ( you have to make allowances for heavy traffic at these times!). An excellent service provided by Mears.
reviews.title: Great experience
Superb! Magical! Unforgettable!
reviews.text: Orlando Premium Outlets is quite nearby - a good 20 min walk - the shopping here is excellent for all your discounted designer wear, sports wear etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anytime we wanted to travel anywhere we always took a taxi. There were always a couple sitting at the entrances to the hotels and we found them to be quite reasonable $12 to SeaWorld, $22 to Magic Kingdom.
reviews.title: Clean but Cheap - Cheap - Cheap

aka: Fairfield Inn Orlando Lake Buena Vista In The Marriott Village Hotel
